data.title: Current time in Germany
data.meta_description: Germany local time. Find the current time in the Germany timezone and all of its cities.
data.text:
Local time in Germany

The time in Germany is 2 hours ahead of UTC and the same as in Frankfurt am Main. The current timezone in Germany is Central European Summer Time (CEST). Germany is currently observing Daylight Saving Time (DST) also known as summer time. Daylight Saving Time in Germany ends at Oct. 27, 2024.

Details for the time in Germany

Current time

4:19 a.m.

Time zone Central European Summer Time (CEST)

Standard timezone: Central European Time (CET) IANA time zone Europe/Berlin Your time difference same time as Frankfurt am Main UTC time difference UTC+2

2 hours ahead of UTC

Germany Daylight Saving Time (DST)

Germany uses Daylight Saving Time. In the table below you can find out when DST begins and when DST ends in Germany.

DST started at March 31, 2024

Sets the clock forward 1 hour DST is ending at Oct. 27, 2024

Sets the clock back 1 hour Next DST starts at March 30, 2025

Sets the clock forward 1 hour

Germany

Germany uses Central European Time CET and Central European Summer Time CEST. CET is UTC +0100 and CEST is UTS +0200. The longitude of Germanys eastern border is 15° 00' E. Therefore an one hour offset between UCT and CET is exactly as one would expect. Germany is of course one of the biggest countries in Europa. It takes the sun over half an hour to “travel” from Germanys eastern border to its western border. Germany latitude is 51° 00' N, it is therefore not surprising the country uses daylight savings time.
